channel.title: SpeedPaste
channel.description:
I am the creator of SpeedPaste. It is a convenient desktop tool for pasting to pastebin-like websites. Currently it only supports Strictfp Paste (paste.strictfp.com), however I wish to expand it to add more sites and options.
First, I shall explain some details on what SpeedPaste does. It has the ability to load modules for paste sites from the user's computer either via directories in the appdata directory on windows and the user.home property on other operating systems.
SpeedPaste also tracks paste history and minimises to the system tray (from where it can paste from the user's clipboard directly). It can also start when the user logs in (currently only supported on windows).
The source and binary can be found at: https://github.com/speedismeh/SpeedPaste Binary direct link: https://github.com/downloads/speedismeh/SpeedPaste/SpeedPaste-002.jar
I thought some of you might find this useful, and I thought I might be able to get some help with adding more paste sites :)
fap n hate mofoz

item.title: SpeedPaste
item.dc:creator: @SpeedIsMeh SpeedIsMeh
item.description:
@SpeedIsMeh wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:8, topic:465117”]its probably useful if he would implement a paste history so you can get your last ~10 pastes and paste them by pressing [CTRL]+[ALT]+V for an overlay to select the paste you want (with a number or something)

I use Alfred which has this feature all the time.[/quote]
It does have a paste history! Although, doesn’t have the hotkeys, thanks I’ll think of implementing that. It also is quicker than pasting through a web interface as you can right click and paste DIRECTLY from your clipboard, and have the link on your clipboard.

Read full topic

item.title: SpeedPaste
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

its probably useful if he would implement a paste history so you can get your last ~10 pastes and paste them by pressing [CTRL]+[ALT]+V for an overlay to select the paste you want (with a number or something)

I use Alfred which has this feature all the time.

item.title: SpeedPaste
item.dc:creator: @Tmesis Tmesis
item.description:
@Tmesis wrote:

[quote=“KroniKz_, post:6, topic:465117”][quote author=Tmesis link=topic=569731.msg4169165#msg4169165 date=1354063058]
What’s the benefits of having something in between copying from my computer and pasting to a website in 2 clicks?
[/quote]
Ever heard of paste bin?

I think this is what he ripped off.[/quote]
Yes, but it sounds like he is talking about copy and pasting something to a speedpaste to paste to pastebin?

Read full topic
